title: Lead Experience Designer
content:
We are seeking a Lead Experience Designer to join a new game concept in our Casino & Cards group. This small team iterates fast and works strategically to explore new and innovative game ideas to take to worldwide launch.
We’re looking for a driven self-starter with a mobile games and product design focus who enjoys being a generalist. The responsibilities include collaborating through all phases of the design process, including conceptual design/development, graphic and interface design, interaction models, prototypes, user/task flows, implementation in the game engine, and growing a UX/UI team.
The Lead User Experience Designer contributes to the team by developing the Experience Design vision of a product and carries out that vision. This role leads the effort in innovative and pioneering design to create user-centered solutions that promote ease of use, employ best-in-class game/interaction design, and optimize the user experience universally in response to user testing.
You will work closely with team stakeholders to establish and maintain the visual integrity, interaction methods, brand standards, and consistency for the game and collaborate with Product Management, Game Design, Production, and Engineering for the execution of the design.
THIS IS A HYBRID POSITION AND EMPLOYEES WILL BE EXPECTED TO WORK OUT OF OUR DESIGNATED OFFICE LOCATIONS (AUSTIN, TX, BAY AREA, CA, CARLSBAD, CA, CHICAGO, IL, EUGENE, OR, OR TORONTO, CANADA). IT IS EXPECTED THAT ALL APPLICANTS ARE EITHER CURRENTLY LOCATED AT THE MENTIONED LOCATIONS OR OPEN TO RELOCATION.
Job Responsibilities:
UX Design

Collaborate with the product and design teams to conceptualize, define, and develop features that yield outstanding experiences for our players
Synthesize the needs of players and all game departments to find solutions that work for all.
Create user flows, interface wireframes, layouts, prototypes, and design documentation.
Employ the classic design process of defining problems, researching, analyzing, designing, and validating results.

Art

Create UI art and visual design for user interfaces as well as high-fidelity mock-ups for pre-visualization during pre-production
Develop mood boards and help guide the visual design of features
Collaborate with the art team to define/adhere to a thematic art style
Design (and create) functional animation for user interactions

Research & Testing

Participate in the planning and moderating of user testing
Conduct market competitor research and deconstructs
Participate in researching consumer insight, developing personas, and analyzing data
Conduct heuristic evaluations of internal & external products

Technical UI Development

Prepare assets for implementation in the Unity game engine
Create and set up new prefabs in Unity
No scripting is required but is a bonus
Partner with technical artists and engineers to implement user interface game assets in the game engine

Leadership

Be responsible for the task management and career development of other UI/UX staff
Set examples, guides, and standard methodologies in UI/UX for others in your game team and be able to present them to stakeholders and leadership
Lead and participate in company-wide UI/UX community events, critiques, product reviews, and feature retrospectives
Be responsible for the UI/UX of all features on a specific game team
Collaborate with UI/UX staff from other game teams to share findings and develop standard methodologies across the organization
Mentor other UI/UX individual contributors

Applicant’s Proficiencies
General

Ability to adapt and work in a fast-paced setting. Rapidly develop new skills and behaviors in response to changing circumstances.
Ability to prioritize tasks, work efficiently, handle time effectively, and complete your work with minimal oversight.
Demonstrates proactive self-development with an interest in leveling up personal, interpersonal, and craft skills
Be organized, demonstrate good digital hygiene, and adhere to established naming conventions and organizational methodologies.
Find opportunities to mentor, and share your knowledge, insight, and experiences with others.

Communications

Able to present complex ideas to diverse audiences and articulate a convincing point of view
Highly proficient in written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing.
Ability to co-work and connect with multiple studio locations, teams, and partners
Able to collaborate with proactive communication and a willingness to build consensus with potentially opposing perspectives.

UX Design

Expert in the application of fundamental UX Design Principles
Seasoned authority on the UX Design process: Defining usability challenges, researching the problem space, analyzing qualitative and quantitative data, designing appropriate solutions, and validating ideas through testing.
Experienced expert in designing for games vs. task completion, specifically supporting fun and engagement
A high degree of competence in assessing and addressing product usability and applying user psychology
An accomplished expert with prototyping design software (Figma, Sketch, or similar tools) and the prototype development process

Interface Design

Mastery of classic graphic design principles
An accomplished expert in user interface layout design, hierarchy, color theory, and information architecture

UI Art

An experienced expert in establishing, implementing, and refining existing visual styles as well as developing new ones.
Can consistently produce high-quality visual assets for user interfaces
Highly skilled with standard creative software such as the Adobe Creative Suite
An accomplished expert with UI layout & design tools (Figma, Sketch, or similar tools)
Familiarity with collaborative virtual environments (Miro, FigJam)
Highly competent in designing and authoring functional UI animation

Technical UI Development

A highly experienced veteran in traditional game development methods, principles, and processes
An accomplished expert in creating user interfaces for game engines (like Unity or Unreal)
Highly engaged and experienced in collaborating and partnering with technical team members such as Tech Art and Engineering
An experienced veteran that fully understands the limitations and best practices of developing games for mobile devices

Level of Experience

Education: Bachelor's degree in HCI, Design, Graphic Design, Industrial Design, or related area required. A combination of education and experience may substitute for a Bachelor's degree.
5+ years of experience in the game development industry specializing in UX, ideally having worked on 3+ different game titles, ideally on mobile
At least 1 year of experience in a leadership role

Software Expertise

The ability to Implement UI in Unity Engine is a must
Figma, Sketch, or other UI design tools
Unreal Engine or similar game engines are a bonus
Axure, Framer, ProtoPie or other interactive prototyping packages are a bonus

What we offer you:

Competitive salary, bonus plan and ESPP (Employee Stock Purchase Plan)
401K Company Match Contribution (US)
RRSP/DPSP company match contribution (Canada)
Health coverage, dental, disability, critical illness, EAP, and life insurance (Canada)
Medical, dental, vision, EAP, life insurance, and disability benefits (US)
Virtual mental health and neurodiversity support programs
Global Fitness reimbursement program
Global Wellbeing Program
Financial wellness program with unlimited access to certified financial planners
Discretionary Time Off policy for many employees
Family planning support program
Generous paid parental, pregnancy-related disability, caregiver, and compassionate leaves
Subsidized Back-up child care
Zynga happy hours and frequent employee events
Flexible working hours on many teams
Culture of diversity and inclusion including employee resource groups
Work with cool people and impact millions of daily player

However, base pay offered is based on market location, and may vary further depending on individualized factors for job candidates, such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. If hired, employee will be in an 'at-will position' and the company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation or benefit program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.Zynga does not  engage in financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process.
